clinical_study.brief_title: Health & Aging Brain Study: Health Disparities TAU Project
clinical_study.official_title: Health & Aging Brain Study: Health Disparities TAU Project
clinical_study.source: University of North Texas Health Science Center

brief_summary.textblock:
By doing this study we are trying to learn more about brain aging in Mexican Americans.
Participants will be asked to complete a screening visit to determine if it is safe to undergo a PET scan.
If eligible, participants will undergo a medical procedure that takes a picture of their brain. This procedure is called a PET scan of the brain.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence or absence of Tau in the brain as measured by PET imaging

intervention.intervention_name: PET scan of the brain with Flortaucipir
intervention.description: PET scan of the brain with non FDA approved Radio tracer.

study_pop.textblock: Mexican Americans that participated in the Health & Aging Brain Study Amyloid Project

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participation in the Health & Aging Brain Study: Health Disparities Amyloid Project
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not a participant in the Health & Aging Brain Study: Health Disparites Amyloid Project
- Medical condition that precludes safe use of PET tracer
